fr.inrialpes.exmo.align.impl

Class BasicOntologyNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.inrialpes.exmo.align.impl.BasicOntologyNetwork
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Extensible, java.lang.Cloneable, OntologyNetwork
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IDDLOntologyNetwork

    public class BasicOntologyNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
implements OntologyNetwork, Extensible
    Represents a distributed system of aligned ontologies or network of ontologies.

      This only works on normalised networks (and returns a normalised network) Like usually, it could be improved as: for each triple of ontologies: o1, o2, o3 al(o1,o3) = al(o1,o3) & al(o1,o2) o al(o2,o3) & al(o1,o2) o al(o3,o2)-1 & al(o2,o1)-1 o al(o2,o3) & ...

      void close(boolean reflexive, boolean symmetric, boolean transitive, java.util.Properties params)
      Computes the transitive, reflexive, symmetric closure of a network of ontology Reflexive: LEFT UNDONE Symmetric: for each pair of ontologies Transitive: for each triple of ontologies, join its alignment with the composition of the others Modifies the network (but preserves the semantics) Reflexivity is left undone (empty alignments in principle) Because it depends on (a) the type of alignment and (b) the ontology language The code below is OK, but no alignment type is available...

      • mergeAlignments

        protected void mergeAlignments(OntologyTriple ot1,
                               OntologyTriple ot2,
                               Alignment newal)
                        throws AlignmentException
        This only works on normalised networks (and returns a normalised network) Combine all alignments into one (add an alignment to those existing merging everything)
        Parameters:
        ot1 - and
        ot2: - two ontology triples
        newal: - a new alignment to integrate with the alignment between these ontologies
        Throws:
        AlignmentException - when something goes wrong (unlikely)

      • close

        public void close(boolean reflexive,
                  boolean symmetric,
                  boolean transitive,
                  java.util.Properties params)
           throws AlignmentException
        Computes the transitive, reflexive, symmetric closure of a network of ontology Reflexive: LEFT UNDONE Symmetric: for each pair of ontologies Transitive: for each triple of ontologies, join its alignment with the composition of the others Modifies the network (but preserves the semantics) Reflexivity is left undone (empty alignments in principle) Because it depends on (a) the type of alignment and (b) the ontology language The code below is OK, but no alignment type is available... generateIdAlignment should be a static method of an alignment type depending on the ontology type
        Parameters:
        reflexive: - if the reflexive closure must be performed (non implements)
        symmetric: - if the symmetric closure must be performed
        transitive: - if the transitive closure must be performed
        params: - parameters to pass to closure (currently unused)
        Throws:
        AlignmentException - when something goes wrong

      • applyComposition

        protected boolean applyComposition(java.util.Properties params)
                            throws AlignmentException
        This only works on normalised networks (and returns a normalised network) Like usually, it could be improved as: for each triple of ontologies: o1, o2, o3 al(o1,o3) = al(o1,o3) & al(o1,o2) o al(o2,o3) & al(o1,o2) o al(o3,o2)-1 & al(o2,o1)-1 o al(o2,o3) & ... But this assumes symetric closure as well...
        Parameters:
        params: - parameters to pass to closure (currently unused)
        Returns:
        true if the composition has generated new correspondences
        Throws:
        AlignmentException - when something goes wrong

      • normalizeAlignmentSet

        protected static Alignment normalizeAlignmentSet(java.util.Set<Alignment> als,
                                                 Ontology<java.lang.Object> onto1,
                                                 Ontology<java.lang.Object> onto2)
                                          throws AlignmentException
        Merge all alignments between the same ontology as one (conjunction) Create a new alignment...
        Parameters:
        als: - a set of alignments
        onto1 - and
        onto2: - the two ontologies between which these alignments are
        Returns:
        a new alignment equivalent to als, but normalised
        Throws:
        AlignmentException - when something goes wrong

      • getQuasiNormalizedAlignment

        public static Alignment getQuasiNormalizedAlignment(OntologyNetwork on,
                                                    java.net.URI onto1,
                                                    java.net.URI onto2)
                                             throws AlignmentException
        Only one alignment between onto1 and onto2, rassembling all those existing and all their inverse The two ontologies must belong to the network otherwise they should be failure (Exception, null??) What is missing is the transitive closure... JE: beware: will bug if not provided with BasicOntologyNetworks
        Parameters:
        on: - a network of ontologies
        onto1 - and
        onto2: - the URI of two ontologies between which the alignments will be normalised
        Returns:
        a single new alignment between onto1 and onto2 equivalence to those of the network
        Throws:
        AlignmentException - when something goes wrong

        Parameters:

        reflexive: - if alignments have to be found between the same ontology

      • meet

        public static BasicOntologyNetwork meet(OntologyNetwork on1,
                                        OntologyNetwork on2)
                                 throws AlignmentException
        Intersection of two ontology networks... Creates a new network The semantics used is the reduced semantics in which ontologies identified by their URIs can only be matched to themselves So the homomorphism is trivial TODO: add extensions? i.e., partial clone as BasicAlignment (same in diff and join)
        Parameters:
        on1 - and
        on2: - the two networks to be met
        Returns:
        the result of the meet operation
        Throws:
        AlignmentException - when something goes wrong

      • diff

        public static BasicOntologyNetwork diff(OntologyNetwork on1,
                                        OntologyNetwork on2)
                                 throws AlignmentException
        Difference between two ontology networks... Creates a new network This keeps the ontologies of the first network and suppress from the alignements those correspondences which are there... The semantics used is the reduced semantics in which ontologies identified by their URIs can only be matched to themselves So the homomorphism is trivial
        Parameters:
        on1 - and
        on2: - the two networks to be substracted
        Returns:
        the result of the diff operation
        Throws:
        AlignmentException - when something goes wrong

      • join

        public static BasicOntologyNetwork join(OntologyNetwork on1,
                                        OntologyNetwork on2)
                                 throws AlignmentException
        Union of two ontology networks... Creates a new network Add all ontologies and merge all alignments... The semantics used is the reduced semantics in which ontologies identified by their URIs can only be matched to themselves So the homomorphism is trivial
        Parameters:
        on1 - and
        on2: - the two networks to be joined
        Returns:
        the result of the join operation
        Throws:
        AlignmentException - when something goes wrong

      • getExtensions

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String[]> getExtensions()
        Description copied from interface: Extensible
        Extensions are a way to read and add other information (metadata) to the alignment structure itself. getExtensions returns a set of tripes: uri*label*value all three being String
        Specified by:
        getExtensions in interface Extensible
        Returns:
        a collection of tripes: uri*label*value implemented as String[]
